results.title: His Royal Highness
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: George Wallace plays a stage-hand who dreams that he is King. This is Efftee’s third feature and the first all Australian talking musical film. Some lively songs and an ingenious comic performance by George Wallace. Cast also includes Mona Barlee, Marshall Crosby, Lou Vernon.

results.title: Roads to Xanadu. Part 1: Episodes 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, John Merson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Roads to Xanadu is an intriguing investigation of the dynamic inter- change between East and West in the making of the modern world. Episode 1: “The Price of Harmony” dramatically re-creates the atmosphere of 13th Century China, the richest and most powerful Empire of those times. Episode 2: “The Invention of Progress” examines the interplay and conflict between Europe and the East, which began with the arrival of the Jesuit missionaries in Asia in the 16th Century.

results.title: Bitter Surrender
results.brief_description: A documentary about an overlooked aspect of adoption, the experience of mothers who have surrendered or given up their children. Through the personal accounts of five women, it explores and exposes what the legally enforced secrecy surrounding adoption hides, that the majority of women who relinquish their children face seemingly unresolvable shame and grief.

results.title: Starlife
results.brief_description: Traces the long evolution of a star from its birth in the depths of the black nebula to its final extinction. Based on photographs taken with highly sophisticated instruments, animated drawings which propel the audience through the vast spaces of the universe, and bombard the eye with extra terrestrial imagery of great beauty. To illustrate the different evolutionary paths followed by stars of different masses, a variety of stars is studied. The film also details the process of nucleosynthesis and explains red giants, “bursters”, the warping of spacetime and the mysterious “black hole.”

results.title: Looking into Ms-Dos: A Broader View
results.brief_description: MS-DOS, the most popular operating system, is often under-used or over-abused. This program offers a fuller understanding by detailing basic commands, file naming, hierarchical filing and backing up.
results.description: MS-DOS, the most popular operating system, is often under-used or over-abused. This program offers a fuller understanding by detailing basic commands, file naming, hierarchical filing and backing up.

results.title: Something You Call Unique: A Portrait of Homelessness
results.brief_description: This video program focuses on one of Australia’s largest youth welfare agencies - the Salvation Army’s Crossroads Youth Project. The program examines various issues in the debate about welfare and social justice. This examination is based on the people who are directly involved and various points of view are put forth. Central to the program is the reality of day to day functioning of the Centre as it works with the alienation and frustration of the young people who seek support there. The presentation is frank, and will promote lively discussion on the issues of welfare and homelessness.

results.title: Philippines my Philippines
results.creator_credit: Chris Nash, Maree Delofski and Stoney Desert
results.brief_description: In 1988 three years after a triumphal wave of “people power” swept away the Marcos regime and installed Cory Aquino as Head of State, what is the real situation in the Philippines? Human rights abuses are rife, trade unions are being repressed, poverty and violence are spiralling upwards. This documentary contrasts the hopes of the revolution with the realities of prostitution and the absence of genuine land reform. It shows the connections between slumdwellers organising themselves and the rise of vigilante death squads, between a foreign investment boom and police strike-breakers, between Australian development aid to poor peasants and counter-insurgency strategies. The film combines startling images of beauty and terror with the story of a people betrayed.

results.title: Talking hands 2. Parts 1-9 (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Viewers are introduced to signed English by teaching signs for 300 words most commonly used. Includes practice with short sentences. The vocabulary of the original Talking Hands is extended by 400 signs in Talking Hands 2.

results.title: Signs of Life (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Brisbane College of Advanced Education AV Prod Unit
results.brief_description: The Australian Deaf Community has been an unknown and misunderstood minority group for far too long. In this lively, informative video, the stereotypes are blown away. Here we see deaf people leading normal, purposeful lives, participating in a wide range of activities which their thriving community supports and talking about their lives with inspiring candour, insight and humour.

results.title: Delia Smith`s Home Baking
results.brief_description: Delia Smith’s no nonsense approach to baking strips away the mystique which too often shrouds the subject. Delia covers the entire range of homebaked goodies: bread, pastry, biscuits and cakes. Stick to Delia’s methods and you’ll soon be able to bake successfully anything from wholemeal bread to choux pastry. Rated: G
